qas.question: Who used to reside in the Potala Palace?
How many stories does the Potala Palace contain?
How many shrines exist in the Potala Palace?

answers.text: former summer residence of the Dalai Lama

qas.question: What is 117 metres tall and 1180 metres wide?
Where does the Dalai Lama live?
Where does the Dalai Lama live in the summer?

context: Standing at 117 metres (384 feet) in height and 360 metres (1,180 feet) in width, the <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0><b8_0>Potala Palace<b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/> is the most important example of Tibetan architecture. Formerly the residence of <a0_0>the Dalai Lama<a0_0/>, it contains over one thousand rooms within <a1_0>thirteen<a1_0/> stories, and houses portraits of the past Dalai Lamas and statues of the Buddha. It is divided between the outer White Palace, which serves as the administrative quarters, and the inner Red Quarters, which houses the assembly hall of the Lamas, chapels, <a2_0>10,000<a2_0/> shrines, and a vast library of Buddhist scriptures. The Potala Palace is a World Heritage Site, as is <b7_0>Norbulingka<b7_0/>, the <a3_0>former summer residence of the Dalai Lama<a3_0/>.
